name: AmericInn Lodge & Suites Rexburg _ BYU

reviews.title: Amazing Stay!
reviews.text: Our 3 night stay here was perfect in every way. Immaculate, comfortable, homey, quiet. The staff was friendly and very accommodating for any questions we had. Discounts offered to nearby restaurants. This was comparable to Marriott quality, if not better. Stayed here as our base for a day in Yellowstone. It was a nice drive into the park and definitely a great value and superb accommodations. We love Rexburg, and now it's even better. This spot is definitely a keeper and will have our return business!

Great property. Very homelike feel. Comfy beds, upscale bed linens and cleanliness made for a nice stay. Older TV worked well with good channel selection. I did hear a crying baby early morning next door but all in all a good nights rest.
reviews.title: Sand Dune Delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Value for money. Clean and bright. Great facilities for the basic cost of the room - high speed internet (free), pool, exercise room and breakfast included. If we go to Idaho again we will certainly stay at an Americinn again - I wish they had Americinns in Utah!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great value compared to local hotels

reviews.text: This is the best hotel we've ever stayed at! The service was great! The breakfast was great! The room was great! The pool was great!! All around GREAT!! The hotel staff didn't forget any of the "little things"! We've been with a traveling baseball team for 3 years & have traveled all over, this hotel has been the best yet! We will definetly be staying here again!
reviews.title: STAY HERE!!

reviews.text: Nice little hotel in Rexburg, ID that wasn't too expensive. We stayed there for a baseball tournament and found it to be very affordable. It's out of town a little, but that was okay with us to avoid the congestion of all the other players and families.
reviews.title: Nice little place to stay.

reviews.text: Stayed overnight. Extremely well maintained, both in-doors and out. Our room was very clean and large, certainly meeting all of our needs. We appreciated the wi-fi, clean and pleasant public areas and the breakfast selections.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay !

reviews.text: We stayed here with our new puppy. The only hotel in the area that allows pets at a reasonable price. (they tack on an extra $20 for cleaning) Upon check-in, the room was clean, located on the first floor just outside the entrance. Made it very easy to take the puppy out. The hotel was also located right next door to an Applebee's - good planning on that part! Dining choices in & around Rexburg are limited, so the Applebee's is very busy. But carry out is quick & very popular with other guests. The room had a small fridge & microwave as well. Easy to find off the highway & relatively quiet. There is a trucking company that is behind the hotel so there can be some noise in the morning. Otherwise, we were very happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Good Choice when traveling with pets in Rexburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a full week at AmericInn in Rexburg, ID and truly enjoyed the stay. It's centrally located to everywhere we needed to go and is right off the freeway. It's pleasant, has all the amenities that one needs and they're very helpful with any questions you might have. Their breakfast has plenty to offer for even the finicky ones! Would definitely stay there again and will recommend it to all my friends.
reviews.title: Excellant Overall!

reviews.text: Stayed here July 23rd ,2012 in a 2 room King suite...I have no complaints at all. The location was perfect. The staff were awesome. The room was clean and modern and accommodating. The bed was VERY comfortable. Good water pressure. Loved it! I will stay here over and over!!!!
reviews.title: My Home Away From Home in Rexburg!

reviews.text: Shane S. from Salt Lake City.
reviews.title: Absolutely appalling!

reviews.text: If you're already in Rexburg, this is a perfectly acceptable place to stop for a night. I wouldn't necessarily recommend staying in Rexburg as a general rule, but if you're already here, I suppose its fine to stay the night.
reviews.title: Perfectly Acceptable

reviews.text: This hotel poses as a newer, well-maintained hotel from the outside and even from the lobby. The rooms show quite a bit more wear on them, but they're still acceptable. I can't say I had any big complaints about our stay (except for the half foot of snow we got overnight - I love snow, but I thought I was done driving in it for this trip - it appeared so fast!).
reviews.title: Great place to stop and stay

reviews.text: I don't have anything great to say about the AmericInn, but I don't know why I wouldn't be happy to stay here if I happened to be in the area overnight again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was warm and friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. The rates were great and in the morning we were greeted with a full breakfast of bacon, eggs, waffles, fresh fruit, and much, much, more. I would recommend this hotel to any and all.
reviews.title: Unexpected Pleasure in Rexburg

reviews.text: Rooms are great clean fresh and friendly employees. Recommend this place to anyone. The facility is very warm and inviting and i was very impressed with everything they offer. Also the cookies they had with the coffee were yummmy. They have dvd players and games for kids to play and swimming pool was clean and very well kept. Not one negative thing to say. I am very picky also so this met all and every need i possibly had.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good breakfast selections

reviews.text: yes, the Springhill Suites next door is newer and nicer, but also it costs a lot more. The AmericInn is more than sufficient - good friendly service, clean rooms, fast wifi. The breakfast could be slightly better, though. Location is perfect for a pit stop, just off the highway but also not too far from town either.
reviews.title: great value for money
OK For The Price
reviews.text: I normally stay at the Marriott across the street but they were booked. This place is OK - nothing special. Clean room, bed was comfortable enough, and the breakfast had several good items.
It's a little dated, but I would stay here again if needed.
reviews.title: Overall good, except . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at this hotel before. It's a good, clean hotel and a pretty good value for the price. The breakfast is fairly standard but satisfying. The room is clean and adequate for our family of four. The whole reason we stayed at this hotel though, was so our boys could swim before we continued on our drive south. Unfortunately, the pool was under renovation so closed. We weren't warned of this when making the reservation on line nor when we checked in. I understand that reservations are made on a central booking web site, but there could have been some sort of notice posted on the hotel web site - there was not. I brought this to the attention of the front desk staff when I checked out and they acted like it was a novel idea to let guests know if these sorts of things. It's pretty standard with other hotel chains that I've stayed with (Hilton). There was no attempt to make up for the inconvenience or disappointment. I guess we'll have to find another hotel to stay at when we visit Rexburg.
reviews.title: Bad start to your morning

reviews.text: We stayed here during March 2013. Check in was okay. The room was clean. Check out took 30 minutes, during which time the clerk managed to make two reservations for me that I told him I didn't want. Breakfast was ice cold; the clerk claimed the steam tables didn't work, most of the food was not out, but he had time to cook himself a waffle with whipped cream and strawberries, visible during my 30 minute checkout experience. I would not recommend this hotel, nor would I stay here again.
reviews.title: Great spacious suite and very clean

description: Rexburg's Premier Lodging Property featuring spacious, oversized guestrooms. Luxurious accommodations, including an elegant and warm two-story lobby with fireplace and cozy fireside conversation areas. The hotel features masonry construction, which ensures a quiet nights sleep. Non-smoking property. Features 66 rooms and suites. Spacious indoor recreation area with pool and whirlpool. Meeting Rooms-Up to 120 person capacity, great for weddings, company meetings, or parties. High speed internet available in every room. Free enhanced breakfast buffet, the best you will find in town. Coffee makers, clock radios, irons and ironing boards, HBO, high speed internet access, and hair dryers in every room.
